p: Avian influenza viruses do not usually infect humans. However, sporadic human infections with these viruses have been reported mainly in the Western Pacific Region like Vietnam, China, and Cambodia [ 10]. Globally, since 2003 a total of 861 cases of human infection with avian influenza A (H5N1) virus, predominantly of the clade 2.3.4.4, was reported from 17 countries [ 29] (Fig. 1), with a high case fatality rate (CFR) of approximately 52% [ 29].
